page.title: 09CHILDREN'S CARNIVAL
page.content: The annual Children's Carnival in CASTLE CARROCK, usually held in late June, is organised by the Watson Institute Management Committee. Essentially a "day" for the children, rather than a money-raising event, it includes crowning of a Carnival Queen, Fancy Dress competition, children's races, pets' corner, as well as other attractions as available. The "Queen" is chosen by ballot from the girls who are due to leave Castle Carrock school in July. The races are organised by the school staff with the prize money provided by the Hall Committee to offset which various stalls, sideshows and refreshments are operated. The event is very popular with all ages and attracts support from all who live in Castle Carrock and beyond.
